trans-unit.source: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with Huddle | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with Huddle | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use Huddle with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use Huddle with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.

trans-unit.source: For feedback, click <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For feedback, click <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and Huddle.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and Huddle.

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:

trans-unit.source: A valid Azure subscription
trans-unit.target: A valid Azure subscription

trans-unit.source: A Huddle single sign-on enabled subscription
trans-unit.target: A Huddle single sign-on enabled subscription

trans-unit.source: After completing this tutorial, the Azure AD users you have assigned to Huddle will be able to single sign into the application at your Huddle company site (service provider initiated sign on), or using the <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: After completing this tutorial, the Azure AD users you have assigned to Huddle will be able to single sign into the application at your Huddle company site (service provider initiated sign on), or using the <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:

trans-unit.source: Enabling the application integration for Huddle
trans-unit.target: Enabling the application integration for Huddle

trans-unit.source: Configuring single sign-on
trans-unit.target: Configuring single sign-on

trans-unit.source: Configuring user provisioning
trans-unit.target: Configuring user provisioning

trans-unit.source: Assigning users
trans-unit.target: Assigning users

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for Huddle.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for Huddle.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>

trans-unit.source: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.
trans-unit.target: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.

trans-unit.source: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.
trans-unit.target: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Applications</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Applications</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Add at the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: Click Add at the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add application</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add application</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.
trans-unit.target: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the search box, type Huddle.
trans-unit.target: In the search box, type Huddle.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Application Gallery</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Application Gallery</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the results pane, select Huddle, and then click Complete to add the application.
trans-unit.target: In the results pane, select Huddle, and then click Complete to add the application.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Huddle</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Huddle</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to Huddle with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to Huddle with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, on the Huddle application integration page, click Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, on the Huddle application integration page, click Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the How would you like users to sign on to Huddle page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the How would you like users to sign on to Huddle page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Configure App URL page, in the Huddle Sign On URL textbox, type the URL of your Huddle tenant using the following pattern "http://company.huddle.com", and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the Configure App URL page, in the Huddle Sign On URL textbox, type the URL of your Huddle tenant using the following pattern "http://company.huddle.com", and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure App URL</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure App URL</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Configure single sign-on at Huddle page, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: On the Configure single sign-on at Huddle page, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Download certificate, and then save the certificate file on your computer.
trans-unit.target: Click Download certificate, and then save the certificate file on your computer.

trans-unit.source: Copy the Issuer URL value, the SAML SSO URL value and the downloaded certificate, and then send them to the Huddle support team.
trans-unit.target: Copy the Issuer URL value, the SAML SSO URL value and the downloaded certificate, and then send them to the Huddle support team.

trans-unit.source: Single sign-on needs to be enabled by the Huddle support team.
trans-unit.target: Single sign-on needs to be enabled by the Huddle support team.

trans-unit.source: You will get a notification when the configuration has been completed.
trans-unit.target: You will get a notification when the configuration has been completed.

trans-unit.source: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete to close the Configure Single Sign On dialog.
trans-unit.target: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete to close the Configure Single Sign On dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In order to enable Azure AD users to log into Huddle, they must be provisioned into Huddle.
trans-unit.target: In order to enable Azure AD users to log into Huddle, they must be provisioned into Huddle.

trans-unit.source: In the case of Huddle, provisioning is a manual task.
trans-unit.target: In the case of Huddle, provisioning is a manual task.

trans-unit.source: Log in to your Huddle company site as administrator.
trans-unit.target: Log in to your Huddle company site as administrator.

trans-unit.source: Click Workspace.
trans-unit.target: Click Workspace.

trans-unit.source: Click People \> Invite People.
trans-unit.target: Click People \> Invite People.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>People</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>People</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Create a new invitation section, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: In the Create a new invitation section, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>New Invitation</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>New Invitation</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Choose a team to invite people to join list, select team.
trans-unit.target: In the Choose a team to invite people to join list, select team.

trans-unit.source: Type the Email Address of a valid AAD account you want to provision into the related textbox.
trans-unit.target: Type the Email Address of a valid AAD account you want to provision into the related textbox.

trans-unit.source: Click Invite.
trans-unit.target: Click Invite.

trans-unit.source: The Azure AD account holder will receive an email including a link to confirm the account before it becomes active.
trans-unit.target: The Azure AD account holder will receive an email including a link to confirm the account before it becomes active.

trans-unit.source: You can use any other Huddle user account creation tools or APIs provided by Huddle to provision AAD user accounts.
trans-unit.target: You can use any other Huddle user account creation tools or APIs provided by Huddle to provision AAD user accounts.

trans-unit.source: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.
trans-unit.target: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.

trans-unit.source: On the Huddle **application integration page, click **Assign users.
trans-unit.target: On the Huddle **application integration page, click **Assign users.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Assign Users</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Assign Users</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.
trans-unit.target: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Yes</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Yes</linkText>

trans-unit.source: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.
trans-unit.target: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.

trans-unit.source: For more details about the Access Panel, see <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more details about the Access Panel, see <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>.
